criticism: The multipleTransfer function has an integer overflow, allowing an attacker to create arbitrary tokens for any user.
The batchTransfer function has an integer overflow, allowing an attacker to create arbitrary tokens for any user.
The transferFrom function has an integer overflow, allowing an attacker to create arbitrary tokens for any user.
The burn function has an integer overflow, allowing an attacker to set the value of the burner as they wish.
The burnFrom function has an integer overflow, allowing an attacker to set the value of the burner as they wish.
